intro: Anamorpha waltherioides, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Anamorpha waltherioides is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
